slokas: अर्जुन उवाचये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: ।तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तम: ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: "O Krishna, what is the position of those who, with faith, perform sacrifices while neglecting the scriptural injunctions? Are they in sattva, rajas, or tamas?"

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचत्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा ।सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां श‍ृणु ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: The Lord said: "There are three kinds of faith in embodied beings, born from their nature. Hear about them: sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic."

slokas: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत ।श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्ध: स एव स: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: "O descendant of Bharata, the faith of every being is in accordance with its nature. Every being is made of faith.  Whatever one’s faith is, that one is."

slokas: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसा: ।प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जना: ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: "The sattvic people worship the gods.  The rajasic people worship the yakshas and rakshasas. And the tamasic people worship the dead, ghosts, and other such beings.”

slokas: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जना: ।दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ता: कामरागबलान्विता: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: "Those who perform severe austerities without scriptural authority, driven by pride and ego, and fueled by lust and attachment."

slokas: कर्षयन्त: शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतस: ।मां चैवान्त: शरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: "They torture their bodies and the beings dwelling within, with a dull mind, and they consider Me, dwelling within the body, to be their enemy. Know them as demoniac in their conviction."

slokas: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रिय: ।यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं श‍ृणु ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Arjuna, food, sacrifice, austerity, and charity are also of three kinds. Hear about their distinctions."

slokas: आयु:सत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धना: ।रस्या: स्‍निग्धा: स्थिरा हृद्या आहारा: सात्त्विकप्रिया: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: "Foods that increase lifespan, sattva, strength, health, happiness, and joy, that are juicy, oily, nourishing, and palatable, are favored by those who are sattvic."

slokas: कट्‌वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिन: ।आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दु:खशोकामयप्रदा: ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: “Foods that are bitter, sour, salty, too hot, pungent, dry, and burning are favored by those who are rajasic, and they cause pain, sorrow, and disease.”

slokas: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् ।उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: "Foods that are stale, tasteless, foul, rotten, leftover, and impure are favored by those who are tamasic.”

slokas: अफलाकाङ्‌‍क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदिष्टो य इज्यते ।यष्टव्यमेवेति मन: समाधाय स सात्त्विक: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: "He who performs a sacrifice according to scriptural injunctions, without any expectation of reward, thinking only, ‘This sacrifice must be performed,’ he is sattvic.”

slokas: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् ।इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: “O best of the Bharatas, he who performs a sacrifice with a desire for results, or for fame, is considered rajasic.”

slokas: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्‍त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् ।श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: "A sacrifice without prescribed rules, without offering food, without mantras, without gifts, and without faith is considered tamasic.”

slokas: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ।ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: “Austerity of the body is said to be worship of the gods, the learned Brahmanas, and the spiritual master, purity, straightforwardness, celibacy, and nonviolence."

slokas: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् ।स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्‍मयं तप उच्यते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: “Austerity of speech is said to be speaking words that are free from anxiety, truthful, pleasant, and beneficial, and constantly studying the scriptures.”

slokas: मन:प्रसाद: सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रह: ।भावसंश‍ुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: "Austerity of the mind is said to be calmness of mind, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of intention."

slokas: श्रद्धया परया तप्‍तं तपस्तत्‍त्रिविधं नरै: ।अफलाकाङ्‌‍क्षिभिर्युक्तै: सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: “Austerity, performed with supreme faith by those who are free from desire for results and who are united with the Supreme, is considered sattvic.”

slokas: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् ।क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: "Austerity performed out of a desire for honor, respect, and worship, or out of hypocrisy, is called rajasic, unstable, and impermanent."

slokas: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तप: ।परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: "Austerity performed through foolish understanding, or to cause pain to the self, or to torment others, is called tamasic."

slokas: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे ।देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: “Charity given to the deserving, in the right place, at the right time, and to the right person, without expecting anything in return, is considered sattvic."

slokas: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुन: ।दीयते च परिक्ल‍ि‍ष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: "Charity given expecting a return, or to gain something in return, or with a sense of obligation, is considered rajasic."

slokas: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते ।असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: "Charity given in the wrong place, at the wrong time, or to undeserving people, or given with disrespect and derision, is called tamasic.”

slokas: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविध: स्मृत: ।ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिता: पुरा ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: “Om, Tat, Sat - these three syllables are considered to be the designation of Brahman.  The Brahmanas, the Vedas, and the sacrifices were formerly established by these syllables.”

slokas: तस्माद् ॐ इत्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतप:क्रिया: ।प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ता: सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: “Therefore, beginning with the syllable Om, the sacrifices, charity, and austerities prescribed in the scriptures are performed by those who constantly meditate on Brahman.”

slokas: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतप:क्रिया: ।दानक्रियाश्च विविधा: क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्‌‍क्षिभि: ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: “Without seeking any fruit, sacrifices, austerities, and various charitable acts are performed by those who desire liberation.”

slokas: सद्भ‍ावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते ।प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्द: पार्थ युज्यते ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: "The word ‘Sat’ (being) is used in the context of goodness and virtue.  O Partha, it is used in the context of virtuous action."

slokas: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थिति: सदिति चोच्यते ।कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: "Stability in sacrifice, austerity, and charity is called ‘Sat’.  And action that is for the maintenance of these three is also called ‘Sat’."

slokas: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्‍तं कृतं च यत् ।असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Partha, that sacrifice, charity, or austerity which is performed without faith is  called ‘Asat’ (not being).  And it does not bear fruit in this life or in the next."
